BEGININPUT
BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.biography.com/explorer/amelia-earhart
ENDCONTEXT
Amelia Earhart, a trailblazing female pilot, retired from flying after successfully completing her round-the-world flight in 1937. After her retirement, she became a bestselling author, writing about her flying experiences. In 1932, she had attempted to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean but had to abort due to technical difficulties.

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
What happened to Amelia Earhart during her attempt to fly around the world in 1937?

ENDINSTRUCTION

Let's see. So, Amelia Earhart is this famous female pilot, right? And according to what I just read, she retired from flying after successfully completing her round-the-world flight in 1937. Then she became a bestselling author, writing about her flying experiences. Also, in 1932, she tried to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean but had to abort because of technical difficulties.

Now, the question is: what happened to Amelia Earhart during her attempt to fly around the world in 1937? Hmm, but wait a minute, the text says that she successfully completed her round-the-world flight in 1937 and then retired from flying. But I know from other sources that Amelia Earhart actually disappeared during her around-the-world flight in 1937. There's a big mystery about what happened to her.

So, there might be some confusion here. Let me double-check the information provided. It says she retired from flying after successfully completing her round-the-world flight in 1937. But in reality, Amelia Earhart vanished during her attempt to fly around the world in 1937. There was an extensive search, but she was never found, and it's one of the biggest unsolved mysteries in aviation history.

Maybe there's a mistake in the text I read. Perhaps it's not accurate. I recall that in 1932, Amelia Earhart did fly solo across the Atlantic, becoming the first woman to do so. That was a significant achievement. But in 1937, she was attempting to fly around the world, and that's when she disappeared.

So, to answer the question correctly, Amelia Earhart disappeared during her attempt to fly around the world in 1937. She was on a flight with her navigator, Fred Noonan, and they were flying a Lockheed Model 10-E Electra. Their journey began in May 1937, and they were heading eastward. The last confirmed communication was when they were near Howland Island in the Pacific Ocean.

The U.S. government launched a massive search operation, but despite their efforts, Amelia Earhart and Fred Noonan were never found. There are various theories about what might have happened to them, such as running out of fuel and crashing into the ocean, landing on a different island, or even being captured by the Japanese. But none of these theories have been definitively proven.

In conclusion, contrary to the initial statement, Amelia Earhart did not successfully complete her round-the-world flight in 1937 and retire from flying. Instead, she disappeared under mysterious circumstances during that attempt, and her fate remains unknown to this day.
